activities: Findly’s sites allow job seekers to look or offer themselves for work, apply for a job, sign up for alerts or other services, participate in a job survey, take a skills assessment, complete a background check, or perform other career related activities.  To create a profile, all job seekers will need to provide their name, email address, and a password.  Depending on the service that job seekers select, they will also provide contact information such as address and telephone number, information regarding their education and occupation background, information imported by job seekers or their connections from third party sites, information regarding job seeker’s references, resumes, cover letters, work examples, preferences and favorites, and age, gender, race or ethnicity, if permitted by law.  The information that job seekers provide are shared with employers, headhunters, recruiters, hiring managers and other human resource professionals with the job seeker’s consent.
eucountries: Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Croatia, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Iceland, Ireland, Italy, Latvia, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland, United Kingdom
personaldata: Profile data, resume/CV data, cover letters from job seekers, business contact informaiton from employers are processed online.
